metadata.name: Potential Persistence Via Security Descriptors - ScriptBlock
metadata.comment: Detects usage of certain functions and keywords that are used to manipulate security descriptors in order to potentially set a backdoor. As seen used in the DAMP project.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('win32_trustee')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('win32_ace')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('.accessmask')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('.acetype')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('.setsecuritydescriptor')) AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('\\\\lsa\\\\jd')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('\\\\lsa\\\\skew1')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('\\\\lsa\\\\data')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('\\\\lsa\\\\gbg'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of certain functions and keywords that are used to manipulate security descriptors in order to potentially set a backdoor. As seen used in the DAMP project.
